repnme.cdata!: Sri Lanka - Central Bank Strengthening Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Central Bank
            Strengthening Project for Sri Lanka was highly satisfactory,
            the sustainability was highly likely, the institutional
            development impact was high, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the borrower performance was highly
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: The project
            from the design to the implementation stage had highest
            commitment from the Ministry of Finance, Monetary Board,
            Governor and the staff of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka
            (CBSL). Utilization of external staff in project management
            units usually results in delays in implementation due to
            their steep learning curve. The modernization process was
            considered one of the primary activities of the CBSL rather
            than treating it an adjunct to their core functions. Each
            component was led by a senior, technically qualified
            professional and they could muster support from the rest of
            the staff in the bank as well as the other stakeholders in
            the financial sector. The CBSL always aspired to obtain the
            best international expertise wherever necessary. The IDA
            project team responded proactively and was flexible in the
            project components and funding. The modernization process
            was homegrown and spearheaded by the central bank and
            therefore they were able to manage effectively the donor
            interests and contributions to enhance the modernization
            process. The core functions, the payment system, monetary
            policy changes, bank supervision etc. were given a legal
            basis in the relevant laws to ensure long term sustainability.

repnme.cdata!: Sri Lanka - Central Bank Strengthening Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Central Bank
            Strengthening Project is to help restructure and reorganiza
            the Central Bank of Sri Lanka. The project has three main
            project components and several sub-components. The first
            component supports Central Bank reorganization and
            restructuring by establishing a fully professional human
            resources department and reforming human resources policies;
            financing a voluntary retirement scheme as Bank functions
            are streamlined and out-sourced; supporting departmental
            requirements for automation, development of systems,
            consultancies, and training; and upgrading various
            departments such as the Banking departments, the management
            audit department, the Secretariat department, and the
            information/library department. The second component
            improves the payments and securities clearing and settlement
            system, the integrated real-time gross settlement/securities
            system, and the automated general ledger system, and
            provides training and technical support. The third component
            funds financial markets regulation and development, supports
            legal review of the financial infrastructure, supports an
            overview of financial and banking legislation, develops
            legislative frameworks for the systems described in the
            second component as well as for electronic transactions,
            studies e-business, develops the forward market in foreign
            exchange and develops interest rate risk management
            instruments; and funds the supervision of the government
            debt exchange.
